intro: Mitrephora calcarea, commonly known as the limestone mitrephora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in limestone-rich soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
